intro: Arrabidaea chica var. thyrsoidea, commonly known as the Brazilian star-of-Bahia, is a striking flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant features compound leaves with trifoliate or pinnate structures, and its flowers are typically bright yellow with a distinctive violet or purple throat. It thrives in tropical and subtropical regions, often found in open woodlands and disturbed soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it requires well-drained soil and full sun.
